meanings.definition: A four-sided figure with opposite sides that are equal in length and angles that are right angles.
meanings.sent1: I drew two rectangles on my paper during art class.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf is filled with books neatly arranged in rectangles.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to pick up the rectangles, but they kept slipping out of its grasp.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the room, taking in the neat rows of rectangles that lined the walls.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's field was divided into perfect rectangles of different crops, creating a colorful patchwork.

meanings.definition: An object or shape that is rectangular in form.
meanings.sent1: The screen of the television was a large rectangle.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped the gift in a shiny rectangle of silver paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot to nap inside the empty cardboard rectangle.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a silhouette of rectangles against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The new building had a modern design with sleek rectangles and glass walls.
